required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of the Prevention Program Developed for Injuries in Recreational Cyclists
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of the Prevention Program Developed for Injuries in Recreational Cyclists on Physical Performance and Physical Fitness Parameters

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine the effects of personal ergonomic adaptations of the bicycle on the bicycle performance parameters, together with the exercise program training created to prevent biomechanical problems that cause injuries in recreational cyclist.

detailed_description.textblock:
Considering the pandemic period we are living in, people are much more interested in health, sports and nature than they used to be. From this perspective, the interest in cycling, which can accommodate all of these features at the same time, is rapidly increasing. Individuals take bicycle rides in nature in their free time and make this activity a way of life. However, as in every physical activity, factors such as lack of knowledge in cycling, choosing the wrong bike and material, and not knowing the important basics of sports cause non-traumatic injuries in cyclists.
While transitioning from the sedentary life brought by the age of technology to the activity, the musculoskeletal systems of individuals are caught unprepared and even exposed to various traumas and biomechanical problems. Because the looping motion of the lower extremities while cycling occurs primarily in the sagittal plane, power imbalances can develop that affect a cyclist's susceptibility to injury elsewhere along the kinetic chain. The most common areas of overuse injury in cycling are the knee, lumbar spine, cervical spine, hip, Achilles tendon, wrists, and forearm.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: Body fat percentage will be determined by skinfold measurement

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: It will be measured with "1 max rep" (1RM).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated with sit-reach test and modified ober test.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated by shuttle run.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: It is obtained by calculating the force applied while pedaling for 20 minutes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: Average heart rate taken while pedaling for 20 minutes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: The time it takes to complete 10 miles in the fastest possible time is counted.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: It is the estimation of the maximum effort that can be sustained for 3 minutes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: It will be measured with myoton pro.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
primary_outcome.description: It will be measured with Y balance test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
secondary_outcome.description: It will be measured with McGill pain questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 12th weeks and 6th month
secondary_outcome.description: It will be measured with The Nordic musculoskeletal questionnaire

arm_group.description: 12 weeks exercise programme, 3 days a week Bicycle ergonomics will be applied.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Recreational cycling for at least 1 year
- body mass index between 18.5-25 kg / m²
- Obtaining a written health report stating "there is no harm in using a bicycle"
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of fracture, trauma or surgery in the last 6 months
- have any systemic or neurological problems
